tweet:
October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, and my bipartisan CHANCE in Tech Act with @TeamMoulton is designed to tackle one of the biggest challenges facing the tech industry - the skills gap.

Read our joint op-ed in @TheHill ⬇️ https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/technology/468121-apprenticeships-give-a-chance-in-tech-for-all …

Today my amendment to fight meth use in our communities passed the Senate.

From 2011-2018, Colorado experienced a nearly 40 percent increase in admissions for meth addiction. We have to provide new tools and resources to deal with the dangers of meth in our communities. pic.twitter.com/Pu6TH7Mjyn

I encourage my Democratic colleagues in the Senate to do the right thing – Let’s responsibly do one of our most important jobs as Members of Congress and let’s move forward with the defense package that is critical for Colorado military families and our national defense.
Altogether, these political games are holding up roughly $344 million in Colorado military priorities. Enough is enough.
More than $5 million in life-saving medical research at Colorado research centers.
$30 million for innovative and vital cyber missions like CyberWorx – the U.S. Air Force’s partnership that pairs service members with the private sector to solve cyber problems in the U.S.
$10 million for critical cyber security infrastructure efforts at Cheyenne Mountain.
Vital funding for critical access infrastructure such as Gate 19 at Fort Carson.
Full funding of U.S. Space Command, which was recently stood up at Peterson Air Force Base in Colorado Springs, and U.S. Space Force, which will ensure the U.S. remains a global leader in space.

$75 million in first-ever funding for the Defense Community Infrastructure Program, which will be used to fund roads, bridges, energy infrastructure projects, schools, and more in military base communities.
A 3.1 percent pay raise for military members – the largest pay raise for our nation’s troops in a decade.

Last month Senate Democrats shamefully stopped critical national security funding because of petty politics. They’ll have another chance today to allow the defense appropriations bill to be considered in the Senate.
 
If they don’t, here is what they’ll be holding up:

The U.S. should upgrade our military exercises and force posture to assure readiness to defend our allies and interests. Additionally, Congress should pass my bipartisan #LEEDAct with @SenMarkey to impose additional sanctions against the Kim regime.

Forcing a major U.S. military installation to nearly evacuate because of a missile launch, Kim Jong Un continues to show he has no interest in fulfilling his promise of denuclearization. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-missiles-idUSKBN1XA0W0 …

I was honored to be the first Member of Congress to meet with Lee Soo-hyuck, in his new capacity as the Ambassador of the Republic of Korea to the U.S. The U.S.-ROK alliance remains ironclad and we will work together to make it even stronger. #KatchiKapshida pic.twitter.com/0r2fUIiA26

The U.S. Senate unanimously passed my bipartisan bill with @ChrisCoons to strengthen Taiwan’s standing around the world and send a strong message to nations that there will be consequences for supporting Chinese actions to undermine Taiwan.
 
Read more ⬇️ https://cards.twitter.com/cards/18ce53yvxbc/8b8yc …

I introduced a bipartisan amendment to ensure full funding for #LWCF in FY20. This commonsense program comes at no cost to the taxpayer & it's time Congress fully funds this critical conservation program so future generations of Coloradans will have access to our great outdoors. pic.twitter.com/iAgLABGKT6

Deepfakes can be used to manipulate reality and spread misinformation quickly. My legislation that recently passed the Senate would help educate policymakers and the public on these realistic-looking digital forgeries. Read more from @DailySentinelGJ ⬇ https://www.gjsentinel.com/opinion/deep-fakes-huge-problem/article_d760abf2-fa70-11e9-af93-4710cca84a30.html …

Oftentimes, slow information sharing makes it difficult to stop suspiciously large prescription opioid orders. My bill with @ChrisCoons would allow real-time coordination and help keep dangerous quantities of prescription drugs out of our communities. https://riponadvance.com/stories/gardner-seeks-improved-distribution-reporting-on-controlled-substances/ …

That’s why I’m calling for a bipartisan resolution to warn our allies around the world against using Chinese technology to build 5G networks. It’s time for the Senate Democrats obstructing this resolution to explain themselves. https://www.gardner.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/gardner-coons-markey-applaud-committee-passage-of-resolution-warning-allies-of-expansion-of-chinese-5g-networks …

The U.S. is right to be concerned about using Huawei technology – and our allies should be, too. I fully support this action and urge all of our allies to think twice about using Chinese technology in their critical infrastructure. https://thehill.com/policy/cybersecurity/467783-fcc-chairman-proposes-ban-on-use-of-funds-to-purchase-huawei-zte …

The Senate passed my bipartisan bill addressing the rising threat of deepfakes – hyper-realistic fake videos that can spread misinformation quickly. This is a crucial first step to helping policymakers & the public better understand the threats they pose. https://cards.twitter.com/cards/18ce53yvxbc/8al7p …
My full statement on the death of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi: pic.twitter.com/XZev7JjVso

Colorado is facing a devastating rise in suicide rates, and in a mental health crisis there should be no confusion about where to get help.
 
It’s time to make 9-8-8 the number to call in mental health emergencies. More from @CBSDenver ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/aacdE8vKFx

I know how great of an impact any investment can make in our communities.

Opportunity Zones and tax reform are bringing investments, growth, and excitement to Montrose and Grand Junction. https://coloradosun.com/2019/10/24/colorado-opportunity-zone-investment-west-slope/ …

This is great news that demonstrates the value of robust investment in our national scientific institutions like @NSF and @NIST. I'll continue supporting research efforts for quantum science and critical science fields throughout the federal government. https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/america-achieved-quantum-supremacy/ …

.@ChrisCoons and I introduced the Suspicious Order Identification Act to change that – and leverage data in real-time to stop bad actors contributing to the opioid epidemic. https://www.gardner.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/gardner-coons-introduce-legislation-to-address-the-opioid-crisis-through-the-prevention-of-drug-diversion …

A big factor in this epidemic is there's no way to utilize nationwide data in real-time to identify suspicious orders.

Recently the DEA discovered a major drug company was shipping enough prescription opioids to the San Luis Valley for every person to have 30-60 pills per month.
One year ago today, the SUPPORT Act was signed into law – a comprehensive piece of legislation to address the opioid epidemic. I was proud to have many initiatives included, but our work isn't done.

My annual Farm Tour is an excellent opportunity to hear from the farmers, ranchers, and growers who provide food and fiber for the world. This year’s tour was special, as it took place during the @ColoFarmBureau's 100th year anniversary. pic.twitter.com/WzFiNFOqMn

Today I introduced a bill to create a 3-digit phone number for a suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline.

This bipartisan idea would allow Americans to dial 3 digits for any crisis:

9️⃣1️⃣1️⃣ for an emergency, and
9️⃣8️⃣8️⃣ for a mental health emergency

Full statement ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/IAtt0EumQt

Read more about how we can close the gender gap in the cybersecurity field and provide young women opportunities in STEM fields in my joint op-ed with @GirlScouts CEO @SylviaAcevedo. https://coloradosun.com/2019/09/15/cory-gardner-cybersecurity-stem-senate-opinion/ …

The Girl Scout Cyber Challenge is an exciting opportunity for young women to embrace STEM fields, learn to code, and identify cyber threats. I’m proud to support it and I’m glad to see more than 200 Girl Scouts across CO participating in this event at @ArapahoeCC in Littleton. pic.twitter.com/gDjMuTrTFN

I’m glad the AG’s office has now decided to join me in supporting proposed merger between Sprint and T-Mobile. DISH is ready to build out a nationwide 5G network and Colorado and the nation stand to benefit.

Great news ➡️ The Colorado Attorney General’s office has dropped their T-Mobile-Sprint lawsuit. I’ve been championing support for this merger at the federal level, including supporting the @FCC’s approval and the @TheJusticeDept’s settlement. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-sprint-m-a-t-mobile/colorado-drops-out-of-states-fight-to-stop-sprint-t-mobile-merger-idUSKBN1X01QC …

I received a briefing on the Decker Fire today in Poncha Springs from local officials and firefighters on the front lines. We also discussed future recovery efforts. Thanks to everyone who is working around the clock to manage the fire and keep Colorado residents safe. pic.twitter.com/KlQjoclLMp

Colorado is home to more than 500 breweries and the beer industry provides our state with 73,000 jobs. I’m proud to fight for policies to help brewers grow and create jobs across our state, and it was an honor to be named a 2019 Beer Champion by the @BeerInstitute. pic.twitter.com/toS0R1qaer

Today @SenatorBennet, @SenatorTester, and I reintroduced the Close the Revolving Door Act, a bill to ban Members of Congress from ever becoming lobbyists.
 
Read my full statement ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/ShjHu93fzg

It was an honor to introduce Chris McLaughlin, COO of @DENAirport at the @SenateCommerce subcommittee hearing on improving airport security today. Denver International Airport is one of the busiest airports in the nation and I’m proud to support their efforts. pic.twitter.com/7LRUzUGC2J

This resolution explains to our allies and partners around the world that use of ZTE and Huawei technology carries serious security risks and leaves telecommunications systems vulnerable which may require the U.S. to reconsider our security partnerships.

The Senate Democrats who are obstructing this from moving forward should join my bipartisan resolution immediately, or explain why they support giving China access to people’s personal information and other countries’ critical infrastructure.

I have a bipartisan resolution that passed the Senate Foreign Relations Committee unanimously, explaining the risks to U.S. national security if our security partners rely on Huawei and ZTE to build 5G networks. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/16/germany-to-allow-huawei-into-5g-networks-defying-pressure-from-the-us.html …

.@RepCummings was a tireless advocate and one of the most fearless leaders I've had the pleasure of serving alongside. Jaime and I are praying for Elijah's family and loved ones during this difficult time. He will be greatly missed.
Congratulations to Ambassador Barbara Barrett on her bipartisan confirmation as @SecAFOfficial. Read my full statement ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/lCS9hICSCY

Why does ARIA matter? Because we cannot let the Chinese Communist Party shape the future of the Indo-Pacific uncontested.

Promoting democracy and human rights will be vital for the United States to succeed in the Indo-Pacific and ARIA cements that in U.S. law. pic.twitter.com/zkS0yzLRPK

The House just passed a bipartisan measure that I’m helping lead in the Senate urging the Administration to reverse course in Syria. This decision is a grave mistake that’ll result in more instability, create a vacuum for ISIS & lead to a humanitarian crisis. My full statement ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/tfqOstAEv6

Watch live ➡️ I’m about to begin the third hearing in our “ARIA in Action” series, to examine how the @AsiaReassurance Initiative Act, legislation I authored that was signed into law last year, is being implemented. https://www.foreign.senate.gov/hearings/aria-in-action-part-3-implementation-and-the-indo-pacific-strategy …

Exactly right, and it’s not just American networks we should be concerned about. 

Some of our partners and allies are risking the security of communications systems people rely on every day by allowing Chinese telecom companies to build their 5G networks.  https://www.gardner.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/gardner-coons-markey-applaud-committee-passage-of-resolution-warning-allies-of-expansion-of-chinese-5g-networks … https://twitter.com/AjitPaiFCC/status/1184457755484135426 …

Consumers deserve to know if a product they’re purchasing is capable of spying on them.
 
Learn more about my bill to empower consumers and protect their privacy and information here ⬇️ https://denver.cbslocal.com/2019/10/15/smart-device-cory-gardner-thermostat-spying/ …

Happy Birthday to the @USNavy! Today marks 244 years as a force for good around the world. Thanks to all the men and women who have served and continue to serve in the Navy. #244NavyBday pic.twitter.com/6HWFjxKVN4

It was great to be in Fountain discussing new projects to grow the local economy, meet our transportation demands, and ensure access to our military bases by addressing congestion at Fort Carson’s gate 19. pic.twitter.com/zYrONoXEyL

Thank you @NOCOHBA for the work you do in our communities and for hosting me this week in Loveland. I’m proud to work at the federal level to expand Opportunity Zones, enhance housing credits, and invest in our state’s infrastructure to encourage people to make Colorado home. pic.twitter.com/UuOQMwcBs6

Strengthening the partnership between the U.S. and Taiwan is vital to countering China’s aggression and malign influence in the Indo-Pacific. 
 
Read my latest op-ed in @TheHill with @MOFA_Taiwan Minister Joseph Wu ⬇️ https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/foreign-policy/464959-strong-us-taiwanese-ties-needed-to-counter-rising-chinese?rnd=1570600717 …

Shame on the @NBA. This is what communist dictators do, not the U.S.
 
232 years ago in Philadelphia our founding fathers championed individual liberties for all. Today the @NBA is selling these values for Chinese profits. https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/news/local/Philadelphia-76ers-Sixers-Fan-Hong-Kong-Protests-Preseason-Game-Signs-562589301.html …
I’m wishing everyone in the Jewish community in Colorado and across the world a meaningful and thoughtful #YomKippur. pic.twitter.com/D0piCr0j6e
As Americans, we must take a firm stand against censorship and oppression that enables a failed communist ideology.

Let this be a lesson about putting profits above core values when dealing with the CCP. Every time an American company places freedom of speech on the negotiating table with China, democratic values and human rights suffer as a result.

If the world thinks China’s suppression of free speech ends at its borders, don’t be fooled. By continuing to bow down to the Chinese Communist Party, the @NBA is further empowering the CCP to force companies across the world to abandon free speech. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/08/china-state-tv-suspends-nba-broadcasts-after-morey-hong-kong-tweet.html …

The PILT program is an important resource for many counties in Colorado with large amounts of non-taxable federal land. Read more about my efforts with @SenatorBennet to ensure Congress fully funds this critical program. https://www.montrosepress.com/news/gardner-bennet-push-to-fund-pilt-reimbursements-to-counties/article_a634349c-e731-11e9-97bf-ebd8bdd25e22.html …

And Grand County Commissioners and employees were generous with their time to talk about a variety of issues - water projects, fire mitigation, protecting public lands, and building out rural broadband so all four corners of Colorado are connected. pic.twitter.com/J4mTPnZKnn

.@Big_Agnes, @CDNST1, and @RMEF all joined me to work on making the Continental Divide Trail safer. We discussed  securing full funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund, because the #LWCF is critical for Colorado projects like this. https://www.steamboatpilot.com/news/sen-gardner-meets-with-steamboat-business-to-make-continental-divide-trail-safer/ …

Local authorities gave me an update on the Hunt Fire in the Piceance Basin – I’m grateful for their dedication and diligence to manage every single fire and keep residents safe. pic.twitter.com/Lpn1paGdLf

It’s been a productive week of meetings across Colorado.
 
I had a great meeting with Rifle community members talking about protecting public lands, the BLM’s relocation to Grand Junction, and helping rural communities thrive. https://www.postindependent.com/news/colorado-sen-cory-gardner-makes-a-stop-in-rifle-during-visits-to-western-garfield-county/ …

October is National Cybersecurity Awareness Month. Learn more and find out what you can do to keep your personal information safe and secure here: 
 https://niccs.us-cert.gov/national-cybersecurity-awareness-month-2019 … pic.twitter.com/wLiE311c9k

I’ll continue to advocate for legislation like my bill, the Energy Savings Through Public-Private Partnerships Act, to incentivize energy efficiency upgrades to federal buildings at no cost to the taxpayer, create a cleaner environment, and lower energy costs.

Today is #EEDay2019 - did you know that 50% of US emissions reductions have come through efficiency gains? While clean & renewable resources provide us with an abundant amount of energy, reducing our overall usage though efficiency is necessary & beneficial to our environment. pic.twitter.com/u90fzixzOg

I always enjoyed working with Speaker Valdez and learning from him. It was an honor to have known him, and I am grateful for his service to Colorado. He knew how to be a force without creating the rancor we see too often today. https://www.denverpost.com/2019/10/02/ruben-valdez-colorado-speaker-latino-obituary/ …

As the Chinese Communist Party celebrates the 70th anniversary of its totalitarian rule, over a million Uighurs are imprisoned in labor camps, millions are repressed in Tibet & millions are on the streets of #HongKong marching for autonomy & human rights. My full statement ⬇ pic.twitter.com/YODCnS18u0

It was great to join the @CDNST1, the @RMEF, and @Big_Agnes for a tour of the Muddy Springs area. We discussed the importance of the Land and Water Conservation Fund for Colorado and my bipartisan legislation to ensure full, permanent #LWCF funding. pic.twitter.com/WUXV6uqbu0

Make no mistake about it: North Korea remains a clear and present danger to the safety of the American people. So far no concrete denuclearization has taken place & there should be no efforts to normalize relations with this two-bit dictator. We should return to maximum pressure. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1179190793027952640 …
